title: On Apple TV+, Rose Byrne concludes the 'Physical' saga in fine form
description: The actress stars in the third and final season of Annie Weisman's dark satire on the cult of performance.

title: Niger: West African countries risk unprecedented military confrontation
description: ECOWAS military leaders have declared their readiness to intervene against the junta, although this is considered a last resort. Conversely, Mali and Burkina Faso say that an operation against Niamey would be tantamount to a 'declaration of war' against them.

title: Hollywood studios and scriptwriters' union resume talks after three months of ongoing strike
description: The actors' union, which joined the movement on July 14, did not take part in the discussions, whose contents have not been shared.

title: South Korea: Hot weather turns World Scout Jamboree into political fiasco
description: With the press describing the organization of the event as a 'disgrace,' the South Korean president interrupted his vacation and requested the sending of air-conditioned buses, while some delegations have already left the venue.

title: Vase rescued from 17th-century shipwreck is likely grenade, or piggy bank
description: 'An underground history of France' (10/12). The wreck of a Louis XIV warship off the coast of Toulon was discovered almost intact in 1993. During the last exploration in 2022, a strange ceramic object was brought up.

title: France's Green party sparks controversy with invite to rapper Médine
description: 'It's not the far right who decides,' retorted Greens party leader Marine Tondelier in the face of accusations of 'Islamo-leftism.' Médine, who has been criticized for some of his lyrics, is committed to the convergence of left-wing struggles.

title: Scotland-France: Les Bleus on home stretch to Rugby World Cup
description: Coach Fabien Galthié's men travel to Edinburgh on August 5 for their first warm-up match for the forthcoming World Cup.

title: How French basketball caught on to NBA-style sports business
description: 'Planet NBA' (3/6). Since its creation in 1946, the National Basketball Association has established itself as both an American powerhouse and a global brand. In France, where clubs are mainly based in medium-sized towns such as Cholet and Limoges, the NBA's cultural cachet is hard to resist.

title: Former Pakistan PM Khan arrested after court convicts him of graft
description: Imran Khan was sentenced to three years in jail. The former cricket star had long warned he'd be arrested to prevent him from participating in upcoming elections.

title: In the Black Sea, Ukraine attacks the Russian fleet with naval suicide drones
description: On Friday, the Russian port of Novorossiysk was the target of unmanned marine craft, small remote-controlled kayaks loaded with explosives.

title: France’s birth rate fell by 7% in the first half of 2023
description: Since January, 314,400 babies have been born, 24,000 fewer than over the same period in 2022, according to INSEE statistics.

title: Thousands overwhelm NYC's Union Square for streamer giveaway
description: Some clambered on vehicles, hurled chairs and threw punches at the event for Twitch livestreamer Kai Cenat.

title: Réunion Island dealt impossible task of dismantling wreck stuck on a lava flow
description: The authorities have decided not to remove a vessel that has been grounded since February 2022, deeming the operation too dangerous and without 'net benefit' in environmental terms.

title: From Afghanistan to the Sahel, the counterinsurgency doctrine is in crisis
description: Setbacks in the Sahel and the failure in Afghanistan expose the West's flawed strategy over the last 15 years to root out jihadist rebellions.

title: Côte d'Ivoire's government is decolonizing street names
description: Many of Abidjan's boulevards, avenues and streets are set to be renamed. This major addressing project is designed to improve urban flow and generate economic benefits for businesses and the state.

title: West Africa military chiefs agree plan for possible Niger intervention; US 'pauses' some assistance programs
description: ECOWAS has given the ruling junta one week to reinstate President Mohamed Bazoum, or face the potential use of force.

title: Ukraine seeks new support in Jeddah
description: Following Copenhagen in June and in anticipation of a "peace summit" in the fall, some 30 countries are meeting for two days in Saudi Arabia, at the invitation of the Crown Prince, who wants to make an impact on the international scene.

title: 'Below acceptable standards': Olympic open water test in Seine postponed
description: Days of rian in Paris have lead to concerns of possible sewage pollution in the river. The Seine will be the site of swimming events during next year's Olympic Games.

title: Fire near Spain's border with France spreading rapidly
description: The blaze has been hard to tackle due to mountainous terrain and strong winds.
